Synopsis: Reads a specific value from a PowerShell metadata file (e.g. a module manifest)
Description: By default Get-Metadata gets the ModuleVersion, but it can read any key in the metadata file

Examples.Title: EXAMPLE 1
Examples.Code:
Get-Metadata .\Configuration.psd1
Returns the module version number (as a string)

Examples.Title: EXAMPLE 2
Examples.Code:
Get-Metadata .\Configuration.psd1 ReleaseNotes
Returns the release notes!
